title: [FR] MLFLow model serving responds with json in records format (instead of split)

body:
Thank you for submitting an issue. Please refer to our [issue policy](https://www.github.com/mlflow/mlflow/blob/master/ISSUE_POLICY.md) for additional information about bug reports. For help with debugging your code, please refer to [Stack Overflow](https://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/mlflow).

**Please fill in this bug report template to ensure a timely and thorough response.**

### Willingness to contribute
The MLflow Community encourages bug fix contributions. Would you or another member of your organization be willing to contribute a fix for this bug to the MLflow code base?

- [ ] Yes. I can contribute a fix for this bug independently.
- [X] Yes. I would be willing to contribute a fix for this bug with guidance from the MLflow community.
- [ ] No. I cannot contribute a bug fix at this time.

### System information
- **Have I written custom code (as opposed to using a stock example script provided in MLflow)**:
- **OS Platform and Distribution (e.g., Linux Ubuntu 16.04)**: macOS Big Sur 11.6
- **MLflow installed from (source or binary)**: pip installed
- **MLflow version (run ``mlflow --version``)**: version 1.20.2
- **Python version**: 3.8.3
- **npm version, if running the dev UI**:
- **Exact command to reproduce**:

### Describe the problem
The documentation show https://www.mlflow.org/docs/latest/models.html#built-in-deployment-tools how to pass pandas DataFrames to the model scoring API. The 'split' layout seems to be recommended & the default.

However, it itself responds in the 'records' layout, inflating the returned json (because the column names are repeated for every row).
With 3.4 million rows, and 6 columns with each more than 15 characters, this causes the following error:
```
[error] 18#18: *21 client intended to send too large body: 7446039352 bytes, client: 172.17.0.1, server: , request: "POST /invocations HTTP/1.1", host: "127.0.0.1:5001"
```

The line defining this behavior is the following:
https://github.com/mlflow/mlflow/blob/537158f82b9981b5d440ed81dc5c4c92f2c77edc/mlflow/pyfunc/scoring_server/__init__.py#L175


The docker throwing this was created based on a custom python func flavor, returning a pandas.DataFrame as follows:
```
poetry run mlflow models build-docker --install-mlflow -n my_name -m file:///FullPath/To/my/model
docker run -p 5001:8080 my_name
```

### Code to reproduce issue
Provide a reproducible test case that is the bare minimum necessary to generate the problem.

Sending a dataframe similar to, but with 3.4 million rows, where the response is a dataframe with 6 columns each more than 15 characters
```
curl http://127.0.0.1:5000/invocations -H 'Content-Type: application/json' -d '{
    "columns": ["a", "b", "c"],
    "data": [[1, 2, 3], [4, 5, 6]]
}'
```

### Other info / logs
Include any logs or source code that would be helpful to diagnose the problem. If including tracebacks, please include the full traceback. Large logs and files should be attached.
